title_en: EEG-DLite: Dataset Distillation for Efficient Large EEG Model Training
title_zh: EEG-DLite：面向高效大规模脑电模型训练的数据集蒸馏方法
summary_en: Large-scale EEG foundation models have shown strong generalization across a range of downstream tasks, but their training remains resource-intensive due to the volume and variable quality of EEG data. In this work, we introduce EEG-DLite, a data distillation framework that enables more efficient pre-training by selectively removing noisy and redundant samples from large EEG datasets. EEG-DLite begins by encoding EEG segments into compact latent representations using a self-supervised autoencoder, allowing sample selection to be performed efficiently and with reduced sensitivity to noise. Based on these representations, EEG-DLite filters out outliers and minimizes redundancy, resulting in a smaller yet informative subset that retains the diversity essential for effective foundation model training. Through extensive experiments, we demonstrate that training on only 5 percent of a 2,500-hour dataset curated with EEG-DLite yields performance comparable to, and in some cases better than, training on the full dataset across multiple downstream tasks. To our knowledge, this is the first systematic study of pre-training data distillation in the context of EEG foundation models. EEG-DLite provides a scalable and practical path toward more effective and efficient physiological foundation modeling. The code is available at https://github.com/t170815518/EEG-DLite.
summary_zh: 大规模脑电基础模型在一系列下游任务中展现出强大的泛化能力，但由于脑电数据规模庞大且质量参差不齐，其训练过程仍需要大量计算资源。本研究提出EEG-DLite，一种数据蒸馏框架，通过从大规模脑电数据集中选择性剔除噪声和冗余样本，实现更高效的预训练。EEG-DLite首先使用自监督自动编码器将脑电片段编码为紧凑的潜在表示，从而在降低噪声敏感性的同时实现高效的样本筛选。基于这些表示，EEG-DLite过滤异常样本并最小化冗余，最终得到一个规模更小但信息量充足的子集，该子集保留了基础模型训练所需的关键多样性。通过大量实验验证，使用经EEG-DLite处理的2,500小时数据集中仅5%的数据进行训练，在多个下游任务上取得的性能与使用完整数据集训练相当，部分任务甚至表现更优。据我们所知，这是首个针对脑电基础模型预训练数据蒸馏的系统性研究。EEG-DLite为构建更高效、更具实用性的生理信号基础模型提供了可扩展的实践路径。代码已开源：https://github.com/t170815518/EEG-DLite。
